By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, he said. Eric Schmidt became chief executive in 2001, leading the company alongside its co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin . Meanwhile, a bipartisan slate of U.S. senators wrote to U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton urging her to quash a resolution circulating at the U.N. Security Council which it suggests dictates terms for a settlement. A resolution of this nature would work against our country's consistent position, which has been that this and other issues linked to the Middle East peace process can only be resolved by the two parties negotiating directly with each other, says the letter, signed by 17 senators and initiated by Hillary Clinton Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-N.Y.). soon. Finally, Steve Ballmer spoke briefly of Microsoft's recently announced partnership with Nokia. He once again brought Nokia's chief executive Stephen Elop up on stage, who said that Nokia would support Windows to build strength versus the other mobile platforms . The first Nokia device running Windows Phone is expected later this year.

I have nothing but admiration for Sergio Marchionne for unleashing it, and for his team for executing it.
